sources.description:
Isle of Destiny (1940) is an American romantic adventure film directed by Elmer Clifton, originally distributed by RKO Radio Pictures. This colorized and digitally restored edition brings back to life a little-known public domain title that combined exotic island atmosphere, wartime intrigue, and romantic melodrama. Starring June Lang, William Gargan, and Wallace Ford, the film reflects Hollywood‚Äôs late 1930s fascination with tropical settings and cross-cultural romance, offering audiences both escapism and drama during a period of looming global conflict. By reviving it in full color, this edition appeals to modern viewers across the United States, Europe, and worldwide.

Plot Summary:
The story follows Virginia Allerton (June Lang), a glamorous socialite traveling through the South Seas when her plane is forced to make an emergency landing on a remote island. Stranded in unfamiliar surroundings, she crosses paths with Steve Blaine (William Gargan), a rugged adventurer whose sense of honor and courage quickly capture her attention. Their budding romance is tested as tensions rise with criminal elements on the island, including a cunning smuggler (Wallace Ford) and suspicious locals who see the newcomers as a threat.

The isolated island becomes a backdrop for clashes of loyalty, passion, and survival, as Virginia must choose between returning to her old world of privilege or embracing a new life with Steve in the wild. The conflict builds toward a suspenseful climax, where trust, sacrifice, and love are put to the ultimate test.

Director: Elmer Clifton

When a beautiful aviatrix crash-lands on an isolated Pacific Island, a nefarious gun-runner uses her as bait in an illicit arms deal. A Marine pilot rushes to her rescue from a nearby base, but will his desperate mission succeed?

metadata.Plot: Society glamor girl/aviatrix Virginia Allerton decides to alter her around-the-world flight by stopping off on the Pacific isle of Palo Pango where her brother, Lieutenant Allerton is stationed with a detachment of U.S. Marines, including "Stripes" Thornton and "Milly" Barnes. Local smuggler Barton baits her into a trap using her plane for his gun-smuggling racket and she ends up wrecked on another island. Thornton, as a stowaway on Barton's gun-smuggling plane, and Barnes, by water in a stolen speed boat, rush to her rescue. Inda, the jealous native wife of Barton, with a penchant for dispatching people with poison darts from a blow gun, does her best to do the same for Virginia.
